0: Authorities say 11 people have been arrested in Washington's McPherson Square since Park Police began clearing away tents from one of the last remaining Occupy sites in the U.S. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Workers in protective gear remove tents, camping gear and debris left by Occupy DC protesters in McPherson Square, Sunday, Feb. 5, 2012, in Washington. (Associated Press) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR David Schlosser, who is a spokesman for the U.S. Park Police, said Sunday that one of those arrested was charged with felony assault on a police officer and assault with a deadly weapon. That person is accused of hitting an officer in the face with a brick Saturday evening. The officer was treated at a hospital. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Three others were charged with assault on a police officer. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Schlosser says officials are continuing to clear the park of unsanitary conditions, though so far Sunday the situation had remained mostly peaceful. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR On Saturday night, the protesters vowed to continue their movement and urged followers to remain nonviolent. McPherson Washington. and
